name: Sofitel Buenos Aires Arroyo

reviews.text: I went to Buenos Aires for business and I found my stay at the Sofitel outstanding.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located... kind of BA Art District.
reviews.title: great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very nice and helpful and the concierge gave me great tips about the best places in town.
reviews.title: wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: I loved the bar, which seams to be very popular among the local “beautiful” people.
reviews.title: Great comfortable place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two special words about the bed… huge and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: A luxury hotel with all the trimmings. No significant gripes. You certainly get what you are paying for.
reviews.title: Pretty Fabulous...

likes.disliked: — Not a very exciting breakfast menu

reviews.text: Not a convenient location for exploring on foot. You have to cross one of those 'widest streets in the world' to get to Recoleta and it takes 20 minutes to get there on hoof, but the staff can easily call you a cab.
reviews.title: LOVED the Sofitel!!

reviews.text: We stayed over New Year's and it was sold out months in advance, so if you're booking around then, start early!
reviews.title: Second stay as good as the first

reviews.text: Be sure you have the address/neighborhood of this hotel when you get in a cab at the airport because there are 2 Sofitels in B.A. Also, make sure you get an actual taxi cab and not an illegal one. haha. made that mistake.
reviews.title: Adored the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — The price of the Evian in the room

reviews.text: We just returned from a cruise to Anarctica on the MV Discovery. As part of our cruise land package we were booked into the Sofitel. The Hotel was fantastic from the moment we arrived at 7AM after a long overnight flight and they let us check in right away. The normal check in time is 3:00pm and we were worried as to what we would do until then. No concern at the Sofitel. We were able to sleep for a few hours and then enjoy Buenos Aries. The hotel is in a nice quiet area. Our room was very comfortable, quiet and the bathroom beautiful. The staff were very attentive, spoke english and we felt very welcome.
reviews.title: Not 5-star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights, prior to a cruise around the Horn. I had researched hotels, had written a few, and finally booked through Tablet Hotels, who only recommend the very best. They called it "Traditional Elegance" and gave it 19 out of 20 points. I can't imagine what the missing point was for.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

likes.liked: — The friendliness of the employees, the wonderfully soft beds, and the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were picked up at the airport by a limousine service hired by the hotel, and given the registration forms to fill out on our way to the hotel. Although we arrived in the AM, one of our rooms was ready. We had booked two connecting rooms and they were perfect, with a foyer between the rooms and an outside locking door to the hall.
reviews.title: Beyond the wow factor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We lacked for nothing: free internet(we had our own laptop), marble bathrooms, Roger y Galet amenities, a separate shower and bathtub, free breakfast and wonderful, friendly employees, especially the front desk, concierge Pablo, and the bellboys.
reviews.title: Private oasis, fantastic service
Quality and privacy.
reviews.text: We had drinks in the bar before dinner and fell in love with Pisco Sours. We ate at the hotel restaurant, Le Sud, two nights and went to a dinner/tango show at El Querendi the third night. It was fantastic--both food and show.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our best purchase in Buenos Aires was going to Silvia y Mario's to purchase leather coats. They are the best! We both got lamb jackets--mine had to be made which they do overnight, and my husband had an inside zipper put in his. Both were ready by 1 PM the next day. And they wanted to be paid in cash or personal check, if possible.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent experience

reviews.text: This hotel is truly amazing. Fabulous service, excellent value compared to the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt and Amari Palace, which are all in the same block within a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Sofitel Buenos Aires - a little haven in the hussle of buenos aires

likes.liked: — luxury and attentive service, great location, stunning cuisine.

reviews.text: The area that the hotel in coming from London - I would compare to Belgravia .. very upscale, with a great selection of restaurants all within walking distance of some great restaurants,
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A stunning art deco building in the most charming parisian looking street in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Walking distance to everywhere.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We also stayed in Palmero which is more like Notting Hill in London - a different experience - but this hotel was superb, amazing breakfast and definately the place to stay in town.
reviews.title: Top Comfort, Top Service, Top Location

likes.disliked: — The plugs do not accept 220 V. You must ask for adaptors at front desk. We've seen adaptable plugs in other Argentinian locations

description: Sofitel Buenos Aires is located in the tranquil and charming Arroyo Street, surrounded by enchanting and quiet sidewalks flanked by trees, the area is a heaven made up of antique shops and art galleries, a true epicenter of culture. The hotel features a perfect blend of the French savoir faire and the Argentine tradition, with an ambiance complementing exquisite decor and the delicate scents of soft flowers, awakening the senses of the guest and giving them the feeling of being where true luxury sits.
